lesson_description: In this lesson, students use fraction strips and number line models to investigate the division of fractions by fractions.‚Äã They use these models to develop an algorithm for rewriting division sentences as multiplication sentences. Students then apply the procedure to solve problems involving fractions and mixed numbers.
learning_goals: I can model the division of fractions using pictures, bar models, and number lines.
I can interpret and compute quotients of fractions.
essential_ideas: You can use area models and fact families to illustrate the quotients of fractions.
The reciprocal or multiplicative inverse of a number a/b is the number b/a, where a and b are nonzero numbers.
To calculate the quotient of two fractions, multiply the dividend by the reciprocal of the divisor.

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: Fraction ÷ Fraction

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: Moving from the Model to a Procedure
lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.description: Students develop an algorithm to rewrite division sentences as multiplication sentences.

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: A Vision of Division
